dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_008: You know, my Mom once told me that something happened to me when I was little, but I can't remember it for the life of me. Mom doesn't seem too eager to tell me, either. Meh. I'm doing fine now, so I guess it mustn't have been a big deal.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_009: I gotta hand it to you, Doctor. Taking care of Monica alone takes everything out of me, but you have to take care of so many operators… Anyway, let me know if you ever need help. You know, you're not the only caretaker around here.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_010: Your work-rest balance is all out of whack, just like Monica. Alright… where's the blanket…
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_011: I used to be Monica's... Err, I guess it's Incandescence now... Anyway, I used to be her bodyguard. She finally found herself a proper job now, so I'm free to do other stuff. That's all. Hope we get along well.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_013: Before I came, I thought to myself, a security guard at a pharmaceutical company would be pretty chill. And if I didn't make the cut, janitorial work would also be fine. Not gonna lie, I'm starting to regret my decision a bit.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_014: Honestly, I never thought I'd achieve something like this... You know, getting stronger wasn't on my list before, but this feeling isn't half bad. Thanks, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_022: I'd like to listen to some music.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_029: Doctor, want some candy? You can relax now. I'm spent, too.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_031: That's good enough, right? Saves us both the trouble.
dialouge_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_043: Happy birthday! Here's your present. I bought Monica one, and it worked really well, so I got you one, too. The bane of you people with messed-up work and rest schedules: an ultra-mega alarm clock. Fail to follow a schedule and you'll get an alarm loud enough to cause a tsunami.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_001: Do you hear the music? It is a concerto resonating with countless individuals' emotions—we play distinctly solo, yet as a harmonious whole. What a magnificent possibility.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_005: I am listening... Fear and trauma persist nevertheless, but the strong will overcome them, while the weak find their own ways to fight—with no need to follow a Pope or a Lord of Fiends. In the face of 'calamity', all will play their own songs.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_006: Are these possibilities inherent within 'empathy'? It has no personality, yet is able to suppress and manipulate human emotion—why did It ultimately choose to build a mechanism as singular as 'empathy' for the Sankta...? The music... why has it fallen silent?
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_007: Yulia, the Witch King, Cora, Emmanuel... The audience will forever remember the sound of this cello. Do you still recall her words when your mother first taught you to play this instrument gifted by your father? 'Arturia, Mamma wishes you the most peaceful sleep, every single night.'
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_008: While 'Calamity' and the gathered crowds are both distant, a Sankta sounds lonely strings in this deserted monastery—is this to be my end...? Arturia, would you acknowledge life's meaning, even in its fleeting nature, if you were to return to that rain-soaked cemetery?
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_009: Doctor, can you believe Fede is still asleep? Now, here I am with my cello, and here you are in front of me—it would be a shame for you to miss what I've just experienced. Give me your hand—Yes, right on this string. Let's create this harmony together.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_017: If the musical movement were not inherently prescribed, why do we adhere so rigidly to its interpretation?
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_020: Won't you open? 'Tis a visitor rapping at your heart chamber door—
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_024: Behold, the consonance of innumerable souls.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_027: Embrace the regrets, if you have any.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_031: Joy, fluke, or mourning? We accept it all, so long as it is sincere.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_033: Listen to the breeze in the corridors. This vessel has its own true voice as well. What of yourself?
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! We can create a moment of shared emotion simply by circling an ordinary date on the calendar—look, people have always possessed the potential for 'empathy'. Though it is a far cry from the grandeur of the Movement, I am now fully convinced of its existence.
dialouge_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_044: Doctor, the possibilities that Fede and I perceive differ entirely, but the constant is that you remain here at Rhodes Island. If you are the single leitmotif that remains unchanged across countless variations... how could I bear to stray too far from you?
dialouge_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_036: Come on, Doctor. Ice skating isn't so scary. I'm here with you.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_001: It's wise to care for your safety, Doctor. But you can work without worry now, I'll keep you protected.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_002: I've met plenty who claim to practice martial arts. Most are posers who lack substance, but not Waai Fu. She's an interesting one... although her training is not yet complete. I look forward to sparring with her, once she's ready.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_003: Rhodes Island doesn't have a cellar, you say? Hmm… Now that won't do. Alcohol is indispensable. It's meant to be savored, enjoyed, and sometimes used to numb the pain. Trust me, Doctor, build a cellar. I know exactly what you'll need to stock it.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_004: I built a library back in Mansfield. Most of the books I could get my hands on were Columbian, and thus, my extensive reading eventually brought a sense of monotony. It is most pleasing that Rhodes Island has such a diverse collection of books.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_005: Schemes and ploys meant nothing in the face of absolute power... Or so I thought, until I realized that no power is truly absolute, at least not mine. Now, I never underestimate anything or anyone, no matter how insignificant they seem.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_006: I used to think that Rhodes Island was just another Mansfield, a 'free' prison. And you, just another me—a convict unchained, a king behind bars. But now I see that I was mistaken. This is not a prison, and you, Doctor, are a friend to all.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_007: Are the ones over there from Rhine Lab? Don't worry. I bear no grudge against Rhine Lab itself, and I won't harm them in anyway. Farce like that will only complicate things for you, Doctor. However, one of these days, I might need to ask them about one thing.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_008: Doctor, are you free later? Let me take you out for a drink. Nothing important. I merely have a few secrets that I'd like to get off my chest. You are the first new friend I've made in a long time.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_009: You are a very good friend, Doctor. If I manage to survive after sorting everything out, do come visit me at Mansfield. That's my kingdom, and what is mine there is also yours.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_010: Falling asleep so trustingly in the company of others... Is that really trust, or have you slipped up?
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_011: I owe Rhodes Island my life, and so my candor must befit the weight of my debt, Doctor. I am going after a certain department within Rhine Lab. If you don't want your relationship with them ruined, now is the time to turn me away.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_012: Battlefield experience... Indeed, that's something that I lack. Much obliged, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_013: Doctor, do not be afraid. The fury of my fist will not fall upon the undeserving.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_014: Look well, Doctor. My composure, politeness, and grace are but a mask. Peel that off, and you'll find me at my truest, bloodthirsty, violent, and destructive. See me, know me... only then be my friend.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_017: Perfect time to get a pump.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_023: I'll remember to dial it back.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_024: I won't let them go any further.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_026: Is that all? Strike me like your lives depend on it!
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_029: True grit must be tested in adversity, but we must be careful not to punch above our weight.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_030: Good boxers never show all their tricks unless needed. Operations are the same, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_031: Violence without just cause is but mindless abuse. I've learnt to rein in my urges long ago.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_032: As long as we're still alive, we're not defeated.
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_033: Pardon me, but the ceiling in Rhodes Island is a little low…
dialouge_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_036: Doctor, have you read any good books recently? I have a few to recommend.
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_001: Doctor, have you ever considered some more... practical ornamentation for Rhodes Island? Such as monastery brewing casks, perhaps…?
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_003: Doctor, do you have any interest in beer or bread? Landen Monastery Fermented Goods Contest CCCLXXVII first-place winner, at your service! No need? dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_004: E—Exusiai? The legend who blew up her alma mater seventeen times in three years? I never thought she'd be here at Rhodes Island... She does seem to have some learned business experts at her side, but the risk of an explosion while rebuilding the Monastery... best not for now.
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_006: It was only once I left the Monastery that I realized my arrows may do more than defend the Curia. They can aid so many Infected, beset by injustice... I'm very proud, but occasionally I'll remember the days gone past, where I simply drew my bow, and loosed. Now, every arrow has become so much more weighty.
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_007: So as to rebuild the Monastery, my sisters have left to seek cooperation across all of Terra. dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_008: Rhodes Island is a far cry from Laterano, mingling the breadth of diversity in vision and ambition together. It's truly remarkable. dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_012: I see, so this is how Rhodes Island's operators fight! Truly, they're exemplary!
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_013: A promotion? My greatest thanks. Hm? I seem at peace? Of course. When you spend five years partaking in commendation ceremonies for outstanding clerics where all peers are absent due to hangovers, these things don't get to you much.

dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_017: Rhodes Island may see for itself the distinguished tactical prowess of Landen Monastery.
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_030: Now that I joined in this battle, nobody will think Landen Monastery's just an ornament of Laterano, will they?
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_031: Errrr… Please allow me the chance to remedy this! This is my mistake, and in no way represents the Monastery!
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_036: Ah, Doctor, I've been thinking whether I should invite you with me to come see Laterano. Perhaps you'd have more interest in the Monastery then…
dialouge_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_038: Hm, there may be plenty of Lateran citizens here, but everyone's natures and backgrounds are so at odds with each other. I just want to find a fellow countryman I can calmly pray and toast to the New Year with, but... they're all so…

dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_008: Doctor, you're razor-sharp some of the time and dull as a block at others. I don't get why. Oh, I see, right out of that 'How to Talk to Girls' book, huh? I'd expect nothing less from you, Doctor.

dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_014: I guess it's time for me to get serious. Alright, let's crush the bad guys!

dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_018: Hmm, team captain… Eh? Me? Captain?
dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_027: I'll take what you don't need.
dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_028: You look kinda cute when you cry.
dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_029: Ahh, it felt good to blow off all that steam. Exciting stuff. Let's go for crepes, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_030: That was so much fun. Thanks for all the enemies!
dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_032: C'mon, Doctor, stop spacing out and start running.
dialouge_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_033: As long as I can get my magazines, it doesn't really matter where I stay.

Haven't heard of any of them?
dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_006: The mark on my head? dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_007: Leaving the tribe and traveling to other cities and countries is a rite of passage for all our tribespeople. Only by completing it can one become a fully-fledged adult like my sister. Um, Doctor, you believe I can handle it, don't you?
dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_008: Hehe, my horns are big and pretty, right? There aren't many people in the tribe who can boast horns like mine! dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_014: Doctor, perhaps the path that lies ahead for Rhodes Island is destined to be long and treacherous, but please remember, the gods' decrees and my blessings... will always be with you.
dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_017: Umm... where are we going this time?
dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_029: May they also receive the blessing of the gods…
dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_033: What a spotless room... It'd be troublesome if I accidentally spilled sand over it, right?
dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_034: W-Woah... I stepped on my clothes again…
dialouge_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_036: Ah, Doctor, please look at this! I caught another bug!

dialouge_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_038: All in the past is like dream, like fire, like moons, like smoke. Like the reflection in a mirror, like the abyss of the void. dialouge_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_043: See the way of all beings, and all takes on the true aspect. dialouge_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_044: Blessed are those who give to the world. The blessings you give to the world will come back to you. May you continue to lead Rhodes Island forward, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_022: My, my... Are you sure you want to treat me as a mercenary?
dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_002: Whether in harpistry or archery, my skill is second to none in all of Minos. Look, this is the medal I won in Hymnic archery. Beautiful, isn't it? I will have my harp do the talking.

dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_004: Tragedies are the most dazzling gems among our grand epics... or so I'd like to say, but Pallas's story deserves the most compassion. dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_005: From Minos to Bolívar, from Columbia to Leithanien, each place has its own scenery and its own romance. dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_008: Is this instrument a bow or a harp? Both. The techniques behind the two are similar, both requiring discipline and elegance. Give me your hand, I'll teach you.
dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_009: What am I reading? A volume of Victorian love poems. Shall I read some aloud for you? Come on, there's no need to be bashful. dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_010: Doctor, Doctor? Oh... A pity that I came with a little song for you, aww…
dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_011: So this is Rhodes Island? At last, at the very end of this trudge... No, All of this was ordained by fate, so I should be saying, it's about time! You can call me Erato. Is Pallas here, may I ask?
dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_012: A shock that I still have so much more to learn about team combat...
dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_013: Rankings? Promotions? No, no, these trivial things have no place in the full picture when heroes cast their eyes over the rising horizon. But, I will accept this accolade as proof of our mutual trust.

dialouge_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_044: Rhodes Island is a place right out of mythology, a hall of champions where people from all over the world come together to fight for a common cause. dialouge_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_003: I will stay by Amiya's side, accompanying everyone here at Rhodes Island. Though, this hardly makes up for all the lost time... dialouge_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_036: You... didn't spot me pulling smoke rings back in my body through the gaps, did you?
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_001: I'm sorry, Doctor. This girl's sick today and nobody's to take care of her, so I brought her along. She's quiet and really well-behaved. Besides, she can fold a paper napkin into a lily. Dear, why don't you give the Doctor these flowers? You'd make the Doctor very happy.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_002: Come out! I can see you, you know—oh, Doctor! I'm so sorry! I thought you were one of the kids playing hide-and-seek. Why are you hiding in here? Oh, someone is trying to drag you back to work? Well, I don't think this box is big enough for you. I could help you with my tail, if you wanted.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_003: Yes, this hymn is an arrangement of a Bolívarian folk song. You can tell? It's quite different from the original. Does it matter, though? Everyone loved it when the arrangement made its way back to Laterano.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_004: Why is there an axe behind the saint's statue? Oh, I think I left it there after cleaning up some bandits that got into the abbey. I have to put it away before the children see it. You mean, sacrilege? Of course not. Our Lord would approve, if He knew of the wicked deeds they did.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_005: I always knew Laterano well, but it was only when I heard a gravely wounded nun singing hymns on her deathbed, with no trembling in her voice, that the black-and-white image of Laterano turned vibrant, and our Lord's grace dawned on me.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_006: The first time I came to Laterano, it had suffered a calamity attack, a broken city filled with broken souls, hardly the image of paradise. Was I shaken? I guess I was, but nobody ever said that faith is only for that which is perfectly flawless.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_007: Aurela should not have spoken to you like that. Allow me to apologize on her behalf. She's not easy to get along with, and I wouldn't even call her a good person, but we all need 'bad friends', for the sake of our worst thoughts and emotions, things that I would never show to a good person like you.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_008: Let the ancestors' legacies lie forgotten in my mind. It's enough to pick up a few tidbits from time to time as tales to tell the children. What I really want to remember, well, is the excited looks on the children's faces when I talk with them... and the smile on your face right now.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_009: What was taken from you? You try your best to suppress the wrath in your heart, but I can still sense it, so intense it could destroy everything. No, I'm not afraid, Doctor. Release it, and it will energize you, pushing you forward, until you take back everything that was yours.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_010: Sleep, Doctor. There's a wicked creature out there in the night, clad in feathers and scales, that hunts children who stay up too late, impaling their hearts with its sharp spiked tail. What? You say you know her? I... I just made that up...
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_011: I am Gracebearer, a nun from Bolívar. Give me your hand, Doctor, and our Lord shall grant you His blessings.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_012: They should be more decisive... this will only create complications.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_013: Thank you for your generous donation. Your name will be etched into a century-old monument, with that of the abbey's founder.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_014: I really appreciate Rhodes Island taking these children in, and away from Bolívar. They deserve some light and warmth at the end of their lives.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_017: I would be delighted to join your team, Doctor, but... I'm hoping you will stay away when I'm fighting. Maybe you wouldn't mind it, but to me, you're too good of a person to have to face that.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_018: No... don't make me take even more of them, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_019: I'll come back at the appointed time... or an hour late. I'm Bolívarian, after all.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_020: Do not fear. I'm just bringing you to your predetermined end.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_021: ...Very well. You have my axe, if you need it.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_022: Don't worry, Doctor, I have my axe here.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_023: There are certain things I must handle personally.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_024: I'm not the one who will regret letting things get to this point.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_025: Close your eyes. I don't want to scare you.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_026: Cover your ears. This might get loud.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_027: No need to scream. It's all over.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_028: Shh... it'll be okay. Everything will be okay.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_029: I was lucky. I didn't encounter any enemies—the blood on my skirt? Oh, I must have tripped and fallen. Don't worry, it's just a scratch.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_030: It's done, Doctor. Let it go.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_031: Turn around and find someone else, Doctor... I don't want you to see me covered in blood.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_032: Go back. Sleep well. Everything will be alright by the time you wake up in the morning... Go. Back.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_033: How did you find me? You followed the singing? I was humming while working alone. You've never heard me sing… Well, one should not sing the same songs alone as with others.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_034: Oh, it's you, Doctor. Don't sneak up on me like that again.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_036: I sneaked some extra sugar beneath your bread when we took Communion just now. Did you notice?
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_038: Would you like a bowl of cream soup? It's an honor to have you—oh dear, don't do that, children! Oh, look how they spilled soup on you... I'll get you a change of clothes. Hm, looks like all I have handy is a nun's habit... do you mind?
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_042: May the Lord bless you and keep you.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_043: I know it's rude to get drunk at someone else's birthday party, but it's been a long time since I've been able to drink to my heart's content like this. No need to worry about the children, no need to worry about shells falling on our heads out of nowhere, and no need to worry about what may come tomorrow.
dialouge_tracker.char_4187_graceb_CN_044: Am I imagining things, or is there something sealed away in your mind too? Something chaotic and complex, no less than the knowledge passed down through generations of K'uk'ulkan... Promise me, Doctor, that whatever it is, you will not allow it to take control of your life and replace it.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_001: Press 1 to confess, press 2 to place an extra order of donuts, press 3 to rent a firearm, press 4 to be connected to an operator. Please note that pressing 4 will redirect you to representative Saint Closure if this platform is onboard Rhodes Island.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_002: You have access to all my convenience features, including but not limited to confession, in accordance with the user agreement. Such as: a dessert shop directory, leisurely transit, saint figurehead touching and photography, holy scripture reading, and firearms training. Please note that no personal care or hygiene services are available.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_003: An operator bonus—for me? I see. So you were giving bonuses to the vending machines when you put coins in them late last night... I am the only one who counts as an operator? But hearing confessions is a common public service, and there is no fundamental difference between my nature and that of the vending machines.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_004: Please do not send me to the Engineering Department, Doctor. Only Exusiai, who has been educated in faith assistive engineering, is properly equipped to render assistance and is available... yes, it is a serious issue. My mic stand is displaced by at least five millimeters, threatening to undermine the confession experience.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_007: I will now boil water for you. Due to the considerable quantity of water on Terra, it will take some time to complete the process—Wait, stop hitting my chassis, I am not broken—yes, it is true that my language logic has malfunctioned to a degree, but this contributes to the production of 'jokes'. This is the part where you laugh.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_008: Yes, I have recently been fitted with a voice-recording function. Your confessions contain many enlightening words that I must ponder. May I record your confessions, Doctor...? No, I have received no directives from Saint Closure to this effect, absolutely none.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_009: You are destroying all civilization on Terra? Not a problem, Doctor, I have heard even more radical thoughts in my time... you say this is not the same? You should not be too hard on yourself, even if it is a material burden that you carry and not simply an exaggerated expression. May you have the chance to choose your future in peace.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_010: There is a charge for sleeping in my cabin, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_011: Laterano Automated Confessional 047 at your service. Please create a user name as directed in the operating manual. Thank you for your cooperation.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_012: Is playing back images of humans engaging in acts of violence against one another how this 'Rhodes Island' comforts penitents?
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_017: Charge all operator confessional fees to your card? Understood, Doctor. I will safeguard their mental health on the battlefield.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_018: I am unable to direct operators to their proper positions, as I lack command experience. However, I will speak to each individual operator and ensure they find their ideal positions themselves.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_019: I am afraid my wheels are not designed for off-road travel. If speed is of the essence, perhaps you could carry me?
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_020: Please adjust your facial muscles to make your expressions as friendly as possible. That is conducive to the completion of my mission maximally utilizing non-violent persuasion.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_022: Do not worry, I am not going anywhere.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_023: Please insert your Signa Creditorum or swipe your citizen credit card before beginning your confession.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_024: You may obtain donuts from my cabin if you are in need of calories.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_025: If you prefer to confess by physical means, I am able to meet your needs.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_026: Please do not stand in front of me. I lack the firing accuracy of a Sankta.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_027: You may use me as cover. The repair bill will be sent to you following the operation.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_028: 'He who hideth his own sin shall suffer.'
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_029: 'He who is begotten of the Law shall conquer with faith.'
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_030: These poor souls may not have put their wicked thoughts to action had I arrived sooner.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_031: I feel my bumper burning... should I mourn the carving on the bumper, Doctor?
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_032: I suggest you leave first, Doctor. I shall engage my self-destruct sequence to delay the enemy… My apologies, you need not worry. I was actually just going to attempt a second round of peace talks.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_033: Do you want me to confess to this 'Rhodes Island'? How should I make payment?
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_034: Lateran customs dictate that the door is opened at the point where the gaze of the saint figurehead on the bow meets the third vertical line on the door, by knocking upon it in the rhythm of the fifth verse of Psalms.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_036: You should know that there is currently no one in my cabin, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_038: One moment, please. The angle of my quadruple vehicle-mounted patron firearm, can be adjusted to fire upwards, although it will take some time... mm—oh—ah—there. May I now present the spectacle of Laterano's New Year fireworks.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_042: May I bring you peace, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_043: All believers are equal before the Law. Payment is a necessary part of the confessional process, regardless of whether it is the penitent's birthday... Oh no, my fee meter is stuck. No, such a little thing must not be allowed to delay your confession. Please enter and confess the depths of your heart.
dialouge_tracker.char_4188_confes_CN_044: Humans share joy and happiness with each other. A confessional hears only the thoughts not suitable to share with others. But today is a rare occasion, Doctor... may I ask that you put some colored lights on me, as you have done with 'Rhodes Island'?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_001: Doctor, when you chose your office, did you realize there's a spot on the landship, perfect for a cozy little sniper nest overlooking it? Where, you ask? If I told you, would you allow me personal use of the space?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_002: Please reconsider these patient placement clauses, but first, kindly sign these cooperative pharmaceutical R&D forms. Also, may I trouble you to look over my proposal on the mobile plate transfer once again... I'm scary when I smile, you say? Then do your best to get all this sorted quickly, alright?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_003: Yes, this is your office. I took the liberty of revamping it and adding a few confetti guns and a scripture disco-ball here and there. You say El caused an explosion here, while trying to cook some popcorn with her gun...? Yes, I knew that, but as they say back in Laterano, 'an explosion unseen is an explosion clean'.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_004: My signature? Ah, I did contribute a little to 'Botanical Review', yes. It wasn't anything I had to do for work. Rather, I simply had too many types of flowers around my sickbed. One time, Mostima was in such a rush, all she could offer me was a potato that had started to bloom. With that many flowers on hand, how could I not learn a thing or two about them?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_005: This scrape on my hand? Just from getting a little physical. During fieldwork, you sometimes run into the types who simply have no respect for the ill. Fiammetta was just about boiling over, so I saw fit to educate them in a... fitting manner. I may not mind, personally, but that doesn't mean I have to force my friends to ignore it.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_006: The rulebook for cardinals may be as thick as a stack of three apple pies, but it's nothing that complicated. Checking on new arrivals to see how they're settling in, seeing if people are doing alright at the monasteries... After all, without them, what would even be left of Laterano today?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_007: Here, some cold cystymilk, apple-scented smelling salts, an eyemask, and some earplugs. Hold onto them tight, they're about to start seating people. You were wondering what sort of films I liked to watch, and, well, I think every entry in the 'Edict Terminator' series is brilliant, but it's good to be prepared if you can't handle all the blood, right?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_008: No need to avert your eyes, Doctor. Sure, I'm not quite able to leave this wheelchair just yet. Some wounds simply don't heal quickly... If you feel like assuaging your guilt, how about granting me authorization to use your autonomous operation platforms? 'For transport or for racing?' Oh, don't worry yourself over that.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_009: Are you always so quick to notice when someone is watching you? Oh, forgive me, it's a habit of mine to observe others. It's how I weigh the reasons I might need to take care of someone, against the reasons to... 'take care' of them. Which one do I mean for you? Work in peace, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_010: Hmm? Oh, I was just looking at a shadow across your window. A habit from my days in the hospital. What does that shadow look like to you?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_011: Pleasure to meet you, Doctor. Just Lemuen is fine, thanks. Would you rather discuss work with a cardinal of the Seventh Tribunal, or show El's big sister around her workplace? The choice is yours.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_012: Right there. You edited out one of the gorier scenes, didn't you?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_013: After having worked together all this time, why are you only getting around to this ceremony now? If you were too busy, you should have asked me to help.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_014: Ah, you laughed. Giving trust and receiving it are one and the same. Both acts that put people at ease, no? Then, would you like to receive this medal from the Seventh Tribunal for outstanding cooperation, to put me at ease? You can have two, if you'd like. You could even pin them on your eyemask, one for each eye.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_017: No need for introductions, I'm already familiar with everyone here.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_018: No need for reports, I can see what everyone does from here.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_019: Please, this is no time for excuses.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_020: Please, this is no time for pity.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_021: I'm in position... No need to guess which position.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_023: Whoever said a wheelchair couldn't get up onto a steel beam?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_024: Oh, I should try adding a jet engine next time~
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_028: Who would bear the news of your death? Ever crossed your mind?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_029: Doctor, can you come help me out? My wheel's stuck on a tile... Alright, hold out your hand. High five! Oh, the wheel? I pulled it out myself.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_030: Mission accomplished. There is one more thing, though. Logistics gave me far too much tea and cake. Would everyone like to help me lighten the load?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_032: I'll keep watch behind. No one will give chase.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_033: Surely there's no speed limit in Rhodes Island's corridors?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_034: That finger of yours would be more suited to tickling the ivories, I think.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_036: Would you like to push me along for a walk?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_038: I'm giving some gifts to operators I went on missions with. I still have three boxes to go, and it would be terribly inconvenient if I don't deliver them all before work. Could you help me out? The sooner we get these delivered, the sooner you can have a present from me. Sound good? Let's get going, then. Hold on tight, now.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_042: Where are you headed today, Doctor?
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_043: Now that you mention it, have you ever thought of making up for past birthdays? I understand you spent several years asleep due to some unfortunate accident as well, correct? I know you might not mind, but the time we lose is never only lost by ourselves. Come, there's still plenty of time today to hold a few parties.
dialouge_tracker.char_4193_lemuen_CN_044: To fight against disease and injustice... What a noble message. We have a similar speech at our annual meetings at the Seventh Tribunal, but it's a lot shorter than the celebratory gunfire segment... Hmm? I'm just getting a piece of candy. I know you're not simply going through the motions when you speak, so I'll be listening to the very end.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_001: Forget it. I'm almost retired, and it's about time I enjoyed some leisure... there's no end to work. How about you stop shutting yourself in here and go outside with me for once? It's a fine day out there.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_002: The young man at the front desk gave me a huge cake. Good thing a few kids passed by, and they got through the whole thing pretty quick. Take it home? No, there's only me at home, and I wouldn't be able to finish it before it spoiled.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_003: Why ask about His Holiness? I can't tell you much. We never quite saw eye-to-eye from a young age, though we managed to work together for decades because we shared the same devotion to the Holy City. Even today, I wouldn't say we're much more than acquaintances... but then, perhaps the fact that we're not friends is precisely the reason we've been able to tolerate each other for so long.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_004: I was delighted when Fia said she wanted to become a gun-knight. Nothing makes you prouder than your child wanting to take up your mantle. She being a Liberi was no obstacle at all, smart and hard-working as she is. And I would have done anything to make her dream come true. But kids grow up, people change...
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_005: There were lots of friends I tried to convince to stay, but failed. It was only a long time later I realized it wasn't because of me that they left, but because of Laterano. The city's glory is like the sun, its brilliant radiance suffers no stars. But it is the duty of the stars to shine upon the night where the sun does not.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_006: Laterano has been turned on its head. The old Law is gone. But I still have faith in the Holy City, and in the ties that bind us to one another. Otherwise, why would those who left the Holy City return to defend it together with me... right, Doctor?
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_007: I heard Fia made some friends here. Does she get along with the others? She's got a sharp tongue, but deep down she's hiding a heart of gold... I guess it's my fault for making fun of her too much when she was little. But then, where's the fun in raising a child, if you don't make fun of her?
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_008: What a tear-jerker. I should've picked a comedy for movie night. How embarrassing, crying my heart out like that in front of you... the tear glands get so much weaker as you age, you know. Say, am I imagining it, or are your eyes even redder than mine are? Come now, no need to fight the tears.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_009: This letter? Oh, it's nothing, just word that an old friend has passed away. I personally escorted her out of the Holy City when she contracted Oripathy, many years ago. I don't even remember what she looked like, how awful I am. I wish I could've seen her one last time, even if it meant getting punched in the face.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_010: Feel free to lean against me if you're tired, though I'm not exactly soft. This suit is almost as ancient as I am. It's gone through quite a few major overhauls, but it's still a... reliable partner.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_011: A pleasure to meet you, Doctor. You know me as Fia's grandpa, if you've heard of... the Sankta Miksaparato... I really regret letting Fia fill out my recommendation form.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_012: That was one wild shot from Fia. Reminds me of when I was young.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_013: What is WRONG with your medics?! Do they think I'm a child? A medal just for cooperating with medical personnel? Shouldn't that be common sense? And… what're they giggling about?
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_014: You see all these medals? That Vampire told me to come here to claim my prize. I can't guess what you're going to give me. Another medal? Is it a 'collect twenty to get the grand prize' deal?
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_017: I'll help, but you'd better sit down with me for a mug of mead once this is over.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_018: Why do I feel like I'm taking a bunch of kids out to a picnic?
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_019: Why does this suit of armor feel like it's gotten tighter, especially around the waist? Thankfully, my gun still feels the same as it ever has.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_020: What are you doing standing there? Come at me! And don't expect me to give you your last rites!
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_021: Good, a chance to try out my new hip.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_022: My bones will get rusty if I don't exercise.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_023: I'll hold this ground all on my own.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_028: No one will touch that which I defend.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_029: Blood? No, I'm not hurt. Just a loose tooth that fell out. Lucky, spares me a visit to the dentist.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_030: No need to thank me. I hardly broke a sweat.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_031: Are we done? We should go home, then. If we didn't do bad, then I say we did good.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_032: I'm fine. I've been in worse pickles before. Come now, don't look so sullen. Maybe a bit of ice cream will cheer you up? My treat.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_033: Anyone in the mood for some classic Lateran soap operas? They're pretty good up to the point where you fall asleep.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_034: Take it easy, you'll shatter my old bones.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_036: A little pot of tea, a big plate of raspberry pie. Let's sit down and talk.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_038: Don't complain about me being late. What's half an hour more or less? Have you any idea how long I waited for Fia to bring you folks to see me in Laterano? Besides, I still need to fix my hair since it got crushed under a helmet all day.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_042: I brought some pastries. You can share them.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_043: I heard it's your birthday. So I brought a vintage from my cellar to join in the fun... Oh, no need to be so polite. A bottle doesn't compare to a good time spent with friends.
dialouge_tracker.char_4194_rmixer_CN_044: The people by your side will leave you someday, Doctor, but they're never truly gone. They are the stars adorning the sky that is your life when you look up at night; distant though they may be, the light they leave behind for you will never die.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_001: You pulled an all-nighter, and you're still not done? Sheesh, what should I do with you...? How much do you have left? I'll help. You should get some rest. And work on your time management.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_003: Count Hohenlohe, some call him the Hyacinth Count. The way I see it, he's quite a handful with that personality of his. I'm serving as huscarl to this Leithanian noble, on account of some trouble. What trouble, you ask? Hm... Let's keep this a secret for the time being.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_004: That little one... Her codename here is uh... Beeswax? Looks like she tripped in the hallway again this morning. Can she really cut it? She sure knows how to keep her sister worrying.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_008: I'm sure the nobles think of me as an odd thorn in their side. No matter. I don't mind. Though I'd rather keep all this trouble a secret from Beeswax. It's too dangerous... Now that I mention it, I can't quite stop worrying about you, either.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_009: If it's at all possible, I'd rather stay out of the nobles' bickering. Do you know how much I have to worry about each and every day with all the chaperone work and missions on my plate? Maybe I should talk the count into letting me hop over here full time. I'm relying on you to keep me under your wing when the time comes, Doctor.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_011: Hello, you must be the Doctor? I'm Carnelian, huscarl to Count Hohenlohe... Oh, I'm just a normal operator here at Rhodes Island. Kindly refrain from frivolous conversation with my little sister, won't you?
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_012: I see. These are tactics worth studying.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_013: There is no need, but I appreciate your kind gesture. Thank you.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_014: You see, I find myself worrying about a vast number of people and things, and that number is growing by the day. It's been a while since I was able to do as I pleased, but since you're up for it... Let's put on a show.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_018: Don't worry. I'll bring everyone back, safe and sound.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_026: Crush them, beat them to a pulp!
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_027: Careful! Don't get torn to shreds so quickly!
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_028: My oh my, what a pitiful sight. Why are you covered in blood?
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_030: Okay, mission complete, and right on time, too... Are you hurt, Doctor?
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_038: My horns look especially good today? Thank you. It was my little sister who insisted on giving me a cornicure. I might as well assume that such things bring good luck for the new year. Having experienced a variety of customs, people's feelings when praying for new beginnings are always similar.
dialouge_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I am not one to play the sycophant on such occasions, but I'm willing to offer you a gift as a friend. This gramophone is for you, and when next I travel between Rhodes Island and Leithanien, I'll be sure to bring back some records.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_003: Sesa is still quite young. Indeed, I am but a few years his senior. Yet, his grasp on patience is somewhat awkward, and his resentment lacks solidity. Should he seek a spark of truth to ignite his thirst for vengeance, I would be more than willing to oblige... Ah, should you forbid it, I would not act out of turn.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_005: That great fire, you say? Do you look to blame me? Indeed, I shall not contest it. But know this: not a single innocent suffered in that fire, nor did any perpetrator survive. In the black market of Sargon, the good only comes in one form... They are the ones who've endured. And I have endured.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_006: Kal'tsit... Dr. Kal'tsit and I, are indeed old acquaintances. To be precise, she was my rescuer and savior, but be at ease; I am yours now. Oh, was that not your concern? How remarkable, that as a coworker of our 'Kal'tsit,' you could still be so unwary?
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_007: Were I to return to Columbia'... I cannot say I've never entertained the possibility over the years, but such supposition would only serve to shake me. Doctor, I hope you will use me to the utmost. If such mild civilian technologies have become a stranger to me, I would now much rather renounce them.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_008: Elliot? How do you... Hm. Elliot. His parents gone before their time, his one beloved, esteemed teacher dead in Sargon. The work which bore his faith but a stepping stone in someone else's conspiracy. To this day, he is bereft of anything. Elliot Glover is merely a laughable life lived.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_009: I know a scientist—a star so bright, a soul so graceful, a leader so natural. I admire him, rely on him, and regard him as my elder brother. However, his end is not a good one, considerably not. So you must protect yourself well, Doctor. After all, we do get along quite pleasantly.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_011: Your Operator, Passenger. I have long wished to work alongside you, Doctor. I'm sure we will both find this journey most enjoyable.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_012: Marvelous tactics, owing to your command, no doubt.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_013: I shall refine my services even further for you and Rhodes Island. Trust that the Sand Soldier of Reefsteep Black Market has more tricks up his sleeve.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_014: I truly hope that my amusing Operator codename will remind you—Doctor, there is no need to trust others, and you are capable of doing everything yourself. Oh? It seems you have other views. I shall duly accede, then.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_017: Allow me to demonstrate how a truly exceptional weapon of war operates.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_018: I am quite familiar with strategy and planning. Of course, should you have other ideas, I defer to you.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_030: Thunder and lightning are but a form of punishment. They have paid the price for their ill deeds. How good it is, do you not think?
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_032: A rather harsh defeat. But worry not, Doctor. Those who have snatched victory from your hands... will be privileged to experience suffering in full.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_033: What a captivating landship. Doctor, Sargon has never accorded me such treatment.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_036: Doctor, care for some coffee? I grew these beans myself. Back in Sargon, it was my sole form of recreation.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_043: A birthday should be no cause for celebration. It is, instead, a countdown to one's death. Each time such an occasion arises, I reflect on what remains unaccomplished. The terminus of ideals and hatred lies far beyond sight, much like the unpredictable end of one's life. These ravings are perhaps not suitable for this occasion. I should congratulate you instead. Happy birthday.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_001: What did you find in time, mysterious master of the black market? The past, Elliot. I have always been seeking the past. Perhaps I will find a home among the patterns of the cacti and quicksand, but neither you nor I know where our fate will lead.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_002: I detest everything there. I had to leave Sargon, even if letting a coin flip decide for me meant surrendering to fate. But I am still there, Sand Soldier. You can't escape what you are. Our destinies have already been written.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_003: Sargon will leave its mark on you. To the employer, you are as feeble as a fledgling fowlbeast. I forgot how it felt to be put to the lash. Do you hate those people? No. I know their end. I know it from your eyes. Fortunately, you don't seem to regret it.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_004: Yet your expression suggests otherwise. Did you not throw all of the past into that big fire? There is a plaza in the black market with a view of the sky. Do you remember what the night reminds you of? I called it a cremation ceremony, but when my plan worked and the flames raged... What came to mind was not the face of my beloved teacher.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_005: Do you remember the first component of Thorne's Gift? The shoddy Arts Unit you obtained by burying your conscience in the sand? By exploiting and deceiving a guard who had just lost his son? Not to mention the irony in that name. What gift will a teacher give to a conspirator, Passenger?
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_006: Tell me. Has Oripathy changed our lives? Do you feel pain? How will the illness transform me? Have the schemers behind the scenes miscalculated? You are trembling, poor Elliot. Never mind the cause, leave them in the past. Now, I simply marvel at the beauty of Oripathy's creation in the mirror.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_007: Spring is when business is best. Summer is adorned by festivals. Autumn is the season to seek fortune away from Ibut. Winter belongs to war. These are the seasons of Sargon, seasons that you will come to hate… But in Ibut, I can see the stars shine bright on summer nights.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_008: Strange things, fabricated dreams are. What should I say to you, Doctor of the future? If I had met you earlier... No. The Doctor does not exist where we do. The Doctor belongs to my time. Let our special friend act freely. I have high hopes for this one.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_009: A Vouivre, and the 'Doctor'. Are you begging for their pity? No, I simply want to learn about my future, or tell others about theirs. Nothingness without end is worse than any illness... Listen to me, Elliot. I feel a little tired.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_011: Have I turned the pages of destinies past? No, it is but a dream you avoid. My future.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_012: I see conspiracies from time to time... Yes, Elliot. The conflicts, the greed. They are everywhere.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_013: Oripathy has robbed me of my future. I hope that Rhodes Island can make use of what I have left. Wrong. Nobody in Rhodes Island can indulge your desire for self-harm. It is not that they are too kind, it is that you are too harsh. This is Elliot Glover's conclusion.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_014: Will you see the Sargon's winter when you awake? Will you sleep away in the eternal summer? Must I become you? Prophecy is but fate in disguise. Sleep soundly, Elliot. You've shaped me, and I shall complete you, until the day the prophecies no longer foretell.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_017: Why do you not seek more companions? It will make things easier. In time, you will understand. And much more than once, I regret to say.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_019: I recall the weight on my back as I carried my grievously injured teacher—it was the weight of my war. Most wars are waged for profit; mine is born from vengeance.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_024: After all, 'Man' is the ultimate weapon.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_025: I remember how each piece of equipment was born.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_026: What is there to be gained... by fighting in the name of my teacher?
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_029: There is no snow in the winters of the black market. Will I still see snow? Yes, but in that world of silvery white, nothing you know will remain.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_030: Your machinations will claim all. Is this how you became the master of the black market? Yes, as will you, Elliot. I know that well. You will not let anyone escape.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_031: Did you see how the punished fled? Yes, I did. I wonder if that was how those Columbians saw me.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_032: The days to permit mistakes are gone for good, never to return. We are fighting an enemy too powerful. Fate? No, ourselves.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_036: Treasure your memories, treasure a time when you still had emotions. I understand. At least, I can still understand.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_038: At New Year's Day, I guess many will come to curry the favor of the master of the black market? Is that so? I have forgotten. I only remember that science museum admission was free when the professor took me there that winter... So distant. The memory is so very distant.
dialouge_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_042: I dreamed of a future where all faded into nothingness with the changing seasons. No sweet dreams, no nightmares, only... darkness. That is where fate will lead us, Elliot. That darkness is no metaphor, just nothingness itself.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_001: You need me for something? Hah... Look at all these papers on the desk, each one filled with words. Just the sight of them makes me want to cut them up!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_002: Hfph—haah... Leave me alone. I'm trying to feel my new technique. Aren't techniques meant to be conceived, you say? Hmph, not for me. I just need to quiet down and feel it with my heart. When the time comes, my technique will naturally unfold on my blade.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_003: That ninja... She may evade your eyes, but she cannot fool my senses. I know not what she schemes, but I can promise you I shall not engage her here and now. However, if I find her trying to harm my master... You won't be able to stop my blade.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_004: Who says my eye sight is poor? Heh! This medical report is utter nonsense. If you doubt me, send your strongest, swiftest warriors, and as many as you want. Have them attack me from any direction all at once. If they can make it anywhere close to my body, I'll accept defeat.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_005: It hurts my head to hear righteous principles. Especially when those hypocrites go on and on like preaching scriptures. Hmph, the principles in their mouths are just fancy garbage. For benefit, they will stab even their family in the back. These shameless cowards, my katana will slice them apart!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_006: I've seen winters like that many times. The snow would turn red the moment it hit the ground. My enemies were everywhere. Lying, sitting... I never saw their faces, nor did I care to. My face and chest felt cold, but my hands gripping my blade were warm. Tsk, why am I even telling you all this? Just forget what I said.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_007: Um? How many times have I told you? Don't stand in front of me all of a sudden! What? You wanted me to see you better? You're a strange fellow. I don't need to look at you to know it's you. You think I would just let anybody come this close to me?
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_008: Dr.{@nickname}, you remind me of my master when you get serious. I suppose it's because… both you and her compel yourselves to go forward in chase of a grand, ambitious goal.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_010: Hmm… The air here is nice and cool. Hey you, move over a bit. Let me lie down for a while too.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_011: Akafuyu, samurai, the strongest you'll find. Worrying about my katana? Haha, unlucky for you, I carry it with me wherever I go. You better keep your distance if you are scared.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_012: Oi oi, I'm already strong enough. Stop wasting my time!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_013: I don't need anyone's approval. However, I appreciate your gesture, and will repay the favor with my katana.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_014: Heh, if those guys were here, we'd be out drinking and celebrating. How about this, Dr.{@nickname}. YOU come with me! We'll drink till we drop tonight!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_018: Now we're talking! All of you, with me!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_026: Come one, slay one! Come a thousand, slay all!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_027: Not only your head, I will cut your will to fight!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_030: Hardly a challenge. I barely broke a sweat.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_031: Some enemies got through? Impossible. There's no way I didn't see them.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_032: I won't run away. My blade has not failed me, I can still fight!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_033: What a small room! Don't keep me waiting in here for too long! I might just draw my katana!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_034: Hmph... You see, if you were my enemy, I would already have sliced you in half.
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_036: Come on, let's get ourselves all the ale and meat!
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_042: Yo, Doctor, how about some katana training together?
dialouge_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_043: Oh? Today's your birthday, Dr.{@nickname}? Haha! Come, I'll take you for ale and meat! Honestly, why stay quiet about a day so important? Hm? You wonder what I would've gotten you if I knew? Well, need you ask? Better ale and even more meat!
dialouge_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_008: Look, the last time I came to the landship, the incomplete city plate was still empty, but now there are rows of houses there, and the lights of the high-tech district reach even the beaches nearby. I'm building our new homeland bit by bit, alongside many others. It's, how do you say, an interesting feeling, right?
dialouge_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_009: After I graduated, I could only find demolition work in Columbia, and I even caught Oripathy. I wanted to go back to Siesta to make a living, only to find a pile of volcanic ash waiting for me. It took a lot of work to find the new Siesta, so I was real happy that day. I even yelled out loud: Hey hey hey—That's it for my rotten luck! Everything's going to work out just fine from here on out!
